variance.translation[0].definitions[0].d: the amount by which two or more things are different or by which they change
variance.translation[0].definitions[1].d: the official permission to do something different from what is normally allowed
variance.translation[0].definitions[1].e: The developer requested a variance to build a shopping center on the east side of town.
variance.translation[1].definitions[0].d: the amount by which two or more things are different
variance.translation[1].definitions[0].e: Thereâ€™s a wide variance in the two sets of data.
variance.translation[1].definitions[1].d: the difference between what something actually costs and its usual or standard cost, or its cost when calculated earlier
variance.translation[1].definitions[1].e: A significant variance is one amounting to more than 10% of the allocated budget.
variance.translation[1].definitions[2].d: an arrangement in which a court of law allows a company to do something that would not normally be allowed
variance.translation[1].definitions[2].e: The authoritygranted a variance so the company could install the satellite dish.
variance.translation[1].definitions[3].d: an arrangement in which a local government authority allows someone to do something to their property that would not normally be allowed
